data.name: About_LblInfo1
data.value: A Windows-based client for the Home Assistant platform.

data.name: About_LblInfo3
data.value: This application is open source and completely free. Please check the project pages of the used components for their individual licenses:

data.name: About_LblInfo4
data.value: A big 'thank you' to the developers of these projects, who were kind enough to share their hard work with the rest of us mere mortals.

data.name: About_LblInfo5
data.value: And of course; thanks to Paulus Shoutsen and the entire team of devs that created and maintain Home Assistant :-)

data.name: About_LblInfo6
data.value: Like this tool? Support us (read: keep us awake) by buying a cup of coffee:

data.name: CommandMqttTopic_LblInfo1
data.value: This is the MQTT topic on which you can publish action commands:

data.name: CommandsConfig_BtnStore_MessageBox1
data.value: An error occured while saving the commands, check the logs for more info.

data.name: CommandsManager_CustomCommandDescription
data.value:
Execute a custom command.
These commands run without special elevation. To run elevated, create a Scheduled Task, and use 'schtasks /Run /TN "TaskName"' as the command to execute your task.
Or enable 'run as low integrity' for even stricter execution.

data.name: CommandsManager_CustomExecutorCommandDescription
data.value:
Executes the command through the configured custom executor (in Configuration -> External Tools).
Your command is provided as an argument 'as is', so you have to supply your own quotes etc. if necessary.

data.name: CommandsManager_KeyCommandDescription
data.value:
Simulates a single keypress.
You can pick any of these values: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/windows/win32/inputdev/virtual-key-codes
If you need more keys and/or modifiers like CTRL, use the MultipleKeys command.

data.name: CommandsManager_LaunchUrlCommandDescription
data.value:
Launches the provided URL, by default in your default browser.
To use 'incognito', provide a specific browser in Configuration -> External Tools.
If you just want a window with a specific URL (not an entire browser), use a 'WebView' command.

data.name: CommandsManager_MultipleKeysCommandDescription
data.value:
Simulates pressing mulitple keys.
You need to put [ ] between every key, otherwise HASS.Agent can't tell them apart. So say you want to press X TAB Y SHIFT-Z, it'd be [X] [{TAB}] [Y] [+Z].
There are a few tricks you can use:
- If you want a bracket pressed, escape it, so [ is [\[] and ] is [\]]
- Special keys go between { }, like {TAB} or {UP}
- Put a + in front of a key to add SHIFT, ^ for CTRL and % for ALT. So, +C is SHIFT-C. Or, +(CD) is SHIFT-C and SHIFT-D, while +CD is SHIFT-C and D
- For multiple presses, use {z 15}, which means Z will get pressed 15 times.
More info: https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/system.windows.forms.sendkeys

data.name: CommandsManager_PowershellCommandDescription
data.value:
Execute a Powershell command or script.
You can either provide the location of a script (*.ps1), or a single-line command.
This will run without special elevation.

data.name: CommandsManager_PublishAllSensorsCommandDescription
data.value:
Resets all sensor checks, forcing all sensors to process and send their value.
Useful for example if you want to force HASS.Agent to update all your sensors after a HA reboot.

data.name: CommandsManager_RestartCommandDescription
data.value:
Restarts the machine after one minute.
Tip: accidentally triggered? Run 'shutdown /a' to abort.

data.name: CommandsManager_ShutdownCommandDescription
data.value:
Shuts down the machine after one minute.
Tip: accidentally triggered? Run 'shutdown /a' to abort.

data.name: CommandsManager_SleepCommandDescription
data.value:
Puts the machine to sleep.
Note: due to a limitation in Windows, this only works if hibernation is disabled, otherwise it will just hibernate.
You can use something like NirCmd (http://www.nirsoft.net/utils/nircmd.html) to circumvent this.

data.name: CommandsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox3
data.value: There's already a command with that name. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: CommandsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox4
data.value:
If you don't enter a command, you can only use this entity with an 'action' value through Home Assistant. Running it as-is won't do anything.
Are you sure you want this?

data.name: CommandsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox7
data.value:
If you don't enter an URL, you can only use this entity with an 'action' value through Home Assistant. Running it as-is won't do anything.
Are you sure you want this?

data.name: CommandsMod_LblInfo_Browser
data.value:
browser: default
please configure a custom browser to enable incognito mode

data.name: CommandsMod_LblInfo_Executor
data.value:
executor: none
please configure an executor or your command won't run

data.name: CommandsMod_LblIntegrityInfo_InfoMsg1
data.value: Low integrity means your command will be executed with restricted privileges.

data.name: CommandsMod_LblIntegrityInfo_InfoMsg2
data.value: That means it will only be able to save and modify files in certain locations,

data.name: CommandsMod_LblIntegrityInfo_InfoMsg5
data.value: You should test your command to make sure it's not influenced by this.

data.name: CommandsMod_LblMqttTopic_MessageBox1
data.value: The MQTT manager hasn't been setup properly, make sure you've configured MQTT and restarted afterwards.

data.name: CommandsMod_MessageBox_Action
data.value:
If you don't enter a command or script, you can only use this entity with an 'action' value through Home Assistant. Running it as-is won't do anything.
Are you sure you want this?

data.name: CommandsMod_MessageBox_EntityType
data.value: Select a valid entity type first.

data.name: ConfigExternalTools_BtnExternalBrowserIncognitoTest_MessageBox1
data.value: Please enter the location of your browser's binary (.exe file).

data.name: ConfigExternalTools_BtnExternalBrowserIncognitoTest_MessageBox3
data.value:
You didn't provide any incognito arguments, so the browser will probably launch normally.
Do you want to continue?

data.name: ConfigExternalTools_BtnExternalBrowserIncognitoTest_MessageBox4
data.value:
Something went wrong while launching your browser in incognito mode.
Consult the logs for m ore info.

data.name: ConfigExternalTools_LblInfo1
data.value: This page allows you to configure bindings with external tools.

data.name: ConfigExternalTools_LblInfo2
data.value: By default, HASS.Agent will launch URLs using your default browser. If you want, you can also configure a specific browser. Additionally, you can configure the arguments used to launch in private mode.

data.name: ConfigExternalTools_LblInfo3
data.value: You can configure HASS.Agent to use a specific executor, like perl or python. Use the 'custom executor' command to launch this executor.

data.name: ConfigGeneral_LblInfo1
data.value: This page contains general configuration items. For more settings, browse the tabs on the left.

data.name: ConfigGeneral_LblInfo2
data.value: Device name is used to identify your machine on HA. It's also used as a prefix for your command/sensor names (can be changed per entity).

data.name: ConfigGeneral_LblInfo3
data.value: Important: if you change this value, HASS.Agent will unpublish all your sensors and commands and force a restart of itself, so they can be republished under the new device name. Your automations and scripts will keep working.

data.name: ConfigGeneral_LblInfo4
data.value: HASS.Agent will wait a while before notifying you of disconnects from MQTT or HA's API. You can set the amount of seconds here.

data.name: ConfigHomeAssistantApi_BtnTestApi_MessageBox1
data.value: Please enter a valid API key.

data.name: ConfigHomeAssistantApi_BtnTestApi_MessageBox2
data.value: Please enter your Home Assistant's URI.

data.name: ConfigHomeAssistantApi_BtnTestApi_MessageBox3
data.value:
Unable to connect, the following error was returned:
{0}

data.name: ConfigHomeAssistantApi_LblInfo1
data.value:
To learn which entities you have configured, and to send quick actions, HASS.Agent uses Home Assistant's API.
Please provide a long-lived access token, and the address of your Home Assistant instance.
You can get a token through your profile page. Scroll to the bottom and click 'CREATE TOKEN'.

data.name: ConfigHomeAssistantApi_LblTip1
data.value: tip: doubleclick this field to browse

data.name: ConfigHotKey_LblInfo1
data.value:
An easy way to pull up your quick actions is to use a global hotkey.
This way, whatever you're doing on your machine, you can always interact with Home Assistant.

data.name: ConfigLocalStorage_LblInfo1
data.value:
Some items, like images shown in notifications, have to be temporarily stored locally. You can configure the amount of days they should be kept before HASS.Agent deletes them.
Enter '0' to keep them permanently.

data.name: ConfigLogging_LblInfo1
data.value: Extended logging provides more verbose and in-depth logging, in case the default logging isn't sufficient.Please note that enabling this can cause the logfiles to grow large, and should only be used when you suspect something's wrong with HASS.Agent itself or when asked by the developers.

data.name: ConfigMqtt_LblInfo1
data.value: Commands and sensors are sent through MQTT. Please provide credentials for your server. If you're using the HA addon, you can probably use the preset address.

data.name: ConfigMqtt_LblTip3
data.value: tip: doubleclick these fields to browse

data.name: ConfigNotifications_BtnExecutePortReservation_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong!
Please manually execute the required command. It has been copied onto your clipboard, you just need to paste it into an elevated command prompt.
Remember to change your firewall rule's port as well.

data.name: ConfigNotifications_BtnSendTestNotification_MessageBox1
data.value: Notifications are still disabled. Please enable, restart HASS.Agent and try again.

data.name: ConfigNotifications_BtnSendTestNotification_MessageBox2
data.value:
The notification should've popped up. If not, check the logs, or check the documentation for troubleshooting tips.
Note: this only tests locally whether notifications can be shown!

data.name: ConfigNotifications_LblInfo1
data.value: HASS.Agent can receive notifications from Home Assistant, using text and/or images. The Local API needs to be enabled for this to work.

data.name: ConfigNotifications_LblInfo2
data.value:
If something's not working, make sure you followed these steps:
- Install HASS.Agent-Notifier integration - Restart Home Assistant - Configure a notifier entity - Restart Home Assistant

data.name: ConfigService_BtnDisableService_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong trying to disable the service. Did you allow the UAC prompt?
Check the HASS.Agent (not the service) logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigService_BtnEnableService_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong trying to enable the service. Did you allow the UAC prompt?
Check the HASS.Agent (not the service) logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigService_BtnShowLogs_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong trying to reinstall the service. Did you allow the UAC prompt?
Check the HASS.Agent (not the service) logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigService_BtnStartService_MessageBox1
data.value:
The service is set to 'disabled', so it can't be started.
Please enable the service first, then try again.

data.name: ConfigService_BtnStartService_MessageBox2
data.value:
Something went wrong trying to start the service. Did you allow the UAC prompt?
Check the HASS.Agent (not the service) logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigService_BtnStopService_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong trying to stop the service. Did you allow the UAC prompt?
Check the HASS.Agent (not the service) logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigService_LblInfo1
data.value: The satellite service allows you to run sensors and commands even when no user's logged in. Use the 'satellite service' button on the main window to manage it.

data.name: ConfigService_LblInfo2
data.value: If you don't configure the service, it won't do anything. However, you can still decide to disable it as well. The installer will leave the disabled service alone(if you remove the service, the installer will reinstall it).

data.name: ConfigService_LblInfo3
data.value: You can try reinstalling the service if it's not working correctly. Your configuration and entities won't be removed.

data.name: ConfigService_LblInfo4
data.value: If the service still fails after reinstalling, please open a ticket and send the content of the latest log.

data.name: ConfigStartup_BtnSetStartOnLogin_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong while disabling start-on-login.
Check the logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigStartup_BtnSetStartOnLogin_MessageBox2
data.value:
Something went wrong while enabling start-on-login.
Check the logs for more info.

data.name: ConfigStartup_LblInfo1
data.value:
HASS.Agent can start when you login by creating an entry in your user profile's registry.
Since HASS.Agent is user based, if you want to launch for another user, just install and config HASS.Agent there.

data.name: ConfigUpdates_CbBetaUpdates
data.value: notify me of &beta releases as well

data.name: ConfigUpdates_CbExecuteUpdater
data.value: offer to &download and launch the installer for me

data.name: ConfigUpdates_CbUpdates
data.value: notify me when a new &release is available

data.name: ConfigUpdates_LblInfo1
data.value:
If you want, HASS.Agent can check for updates in the background.
You'll get a notification (once per update) , letting you know a new version is ready to be installed.

data.name: ConfigUpdates_LblInfo2
data.value:
When there's an update, HASS.Agent will offer the option to open the release page. But if you want, HASS.Agent can also download and launch the installer for you - even less to do !
The certificate of the downloaded file will get checked before execution.

data.name: Configuration_MessageBox_RestartManually
data.value: Something went wrong while preparing to restart. Please restart manually.

data.name: Configuration_ProcessChanges_MessageBox1
data.value:
You've changed your device's name.
All your sensors and commands will now be unpublished, and HASS.Agent will restart afterwards to republish them.
Don't worry, they'll keep their current names, so your automations or scripts will keep working.
Note: the name will get 'sanitized', which means everything except letters, digits and whitespace get replaced by an underscore. This is required by HA.

data.name: Configuration_ProcessChanges_MessageBox2
data.value:
You've changed the local API's port. This new port needs to be reserved.
You'll get an UAC request to do so, please approve.

data.name: Configuration_ProcessChanges_MessageBox3
data.value:
Something went wrong!
Please manually execute the required command. It has been copied onto your clipboard, you just need to paste it into an elevated command prompt.
Remember to change your firewall rule's port as well.

data.name: Configuration_ProcessChanges_MessageBox4
data.value:
The port has succesfully been reserved!
HASS.Agent will now restart to activate the new configuration.

data.name: Configuration_ProcessChanges_MessageBox5
data.value:
Your configuration has been saved. Most changes require HASS.Agent to restart before they take effect.
Do you want to restart now?

data.name: ExitDialog_LblInfo1
data.value: What would you like to do?

data.name: HassApiManager_CheckHassConfig_ConfigFailed
data.value: unable to fetch config, check api key

data.name: HassApiManager_ConnectionFailed
data.value: unable to connect, check uri and config

data.name: HassApiManager_ToolTip_QuickActionFailed
data.value: quick action: action failed, check the logs for info

data.name: HassApiManager_ToolTip_QuickActionFailedOnEntity
data.value: quick action: action failed, entity not found

data.name: Help_LblDiscordInfo
data.value: Get help with setting up and using HASS.Agent, report bugs or just talk about whatever.

data.name: Help_LblGitHubInfo
data.value: Report bugs, feature requests, ideas, tips, ..

data.name: Help_LblHAInfo
data.value: Bit of everything, with the addition that other HA users can help as well.

data.name: Help_LblInfo1
data.value:
Stuck while using HASS.Agent, need some help integrating the sensors/commands or have a great idea for the next version?
There are a few channels through which you can reach us:

data.name: Main_Load_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong while loading your settings.
Check appsettings.json in the 'config' subfolder, or just delete it to start fresh.

data.name: Main_Load_MessageBox2
data.value: There was an error launching HASS.Agent. Please check the logs and make a bug report on GitHub.

data.name: LocalApiManager_Initialize_MessageBox1
data.value:
Error trying to bind the API to port {0}.
Make sure no other instance of HASS.Agent is running and the port is available and registered.

data.name: OnboardingApi_BtnTest_MessageBox1
data.value: Please enter a valid API key.

data.name: OnboardingApi_BtnTest_MessageBox2
data.value: Please enter your Home Assistant's URI.

data.name: OnboardingApi_BtnTest_MessageBox3
data.value:
Unable to connect, the following error was returned:
{0}

data.name: OnboardingApi_LblInfo1
data.value:
To learn which entities you have configured, and to send quick actions, HASS.Agent uses Home Assistant's API.
Please provide a long-lived access token, and the address of your Home Assistant instance. You can get a token through your profile page. Scroll to the bottom and click 'CREATE TOKEN'.

data.name: OnboardingApi_LblTip1
data.value: Tip: specialized settings can be found in the Configuration window.

data.name: OnboardingDone_LblInfo2
data.value:
HASS.Agent will now restart to activate your configuration.
If you've enabled notifications, an elevation request will popup. This is required to allow HASS.Agent to listen on the specified port.

data.name: OnboardingDone_LblInfo3
data.value:
Tip: there's a lót more to tinker with, so make sure you take a look at the configuration window!
Thank you for using HASS.Agent, hopefully it'll be useful for you :-)
And if you encounter any problems, please create a ticket on the GitHub page.

data.name: OnboardingHotKey_LblInfo1
data.value:
An easy way to pull up your quick actions is to use a global hotkey.
This way, whatever you're doing on your machine, you can always interact with Home Assistant.

data.name: OnboardingIntegration_LblInfo1
data.value:
To use notifications, you need to install and configure the HASS.Agent-notifier integration in Home Assistant.
This is very easy using HACS, but you can also install manually. Visit the link below for more information.

data.name: OnboardingIntegration_LblInfo2
data.value:
Make sure you follow these steps:
- Install HASS.Agent-Notifier integration - Restart Home Assistant - Configure a notifier entity - Restart Home Assistant

data.name: OnboardingManager_ConfirmBeforeClose_MessageBox1
data.value:
Are you sure you want to abort the onboarding process?
Your progress will not be saved, and it will not be shown again on next launch.

data.name: OnboardingMqtt_LblInfo1
data.value:
Commands and sensors are sent through MQTT. Please provide credentials for your server. If you're using the HA addon, you can probably use the preset address.
Leave empty if you're not going to use commands and sensors.

data.name: OnboardingMqtt_LblTip2
data.value: Tip: specialized settings can be found in the Configuration window.

data.name: OnboardingNotifications_LblInfo1
data.value:
HASS.Agent can receive notifications from Home Assistant, using text and/or images.
Do you want to enable this function?

data.name: OnboardingNotifications_LblTip1
data.value: Note: 5115 is the default port, only change it if you changed it in Home Assistant.

data.name: OnboardingStartup_AlreadyActivated
data.value: Launch-on-login is already activated, all set!

data.name: OnboardingStartup_EnableNow
data.value: Do you want to enable launch-on-login now?

data.name: OnboardingStartup_Failed
data.value: Something went wrong. You can try again, or skip to the next page and retry after HASS.Agent's restart.

data.name: OnboardingStartup_LblCreateInfo
data.value: One sec, determining the current state ..

data.name: OnboardingStartup_LblInfo1
data.value:
HASS.Agent can launch when you login to Windows, by creating a key in your user profile's registry.
You can always remove (or recreate) this key through the Configuration window.

data.name: OnboardingUpdates_CbExecuteUpdater
data.value: yes, &download and launch the installer for me

data.name: OnboardingUpdates_LblInfo1
data.value:
If you want, HASS.Agent can check for updates in the background.
You'll get a notification (once per update), letting you know a new version is ready to be installed.
Do you want to enable this functionality?

data.name: OnboardingUpdates_LblInfo2
data.value:
When there's an update, HASS.Agent will offer the option to open the release page. But if you want, HASS.Agent can also download and launch the installer for you - even less to do!
The certificate of the downloaded file will get checked. And you'll still see a page with the release notes, ánd you still need to manually approve - nothing is done without your consent.

data.name: OnboardingWelcome_LblInfo1
data.value:
It looks like this is the first time you've launched HASS.Agent.
If you want, we can go through the configuration. If not, just click 'close'.

data.name: OnboardingWelcome_LblInfo2
data.value: Device name is used to identify your machine on HA. It's also used as a suggested prefix for your commands and sensors.

data.name: PortReservation_LblInfo1
data.value: Please wait a bit while the task is performed ..

data.name: PortReservation_ProcessPostUpdate_MessageBox1
data.value: Not all steps completed succesfully. Please consult the logs for more information.

data.name: PostUpdate_LblInfo1
data.value: Please wait a bit while some post-update tasks are performed ..

data.name: PostUpdate_ProcessPostUpdate_MessageBox1
data.value: Not all steps completed succesfully. Please consult the logs for more information.

data.name: QuickActionsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox3
data.value: Unknown action, please select a valid one.

data.name: QuickActionsMod_CheckHassManager_MessageBox1
data.value: Unable to fetch your entities because of missing config, please enter the required values in the config screen.

data.name: QuickActionsMod_LblLoading
data.value: please wait while your entities are fetched ...

data.name: QuickActionsMod_LblTip1
data.value: (optional, will be used instead of entity name)

data.name: QuickActionsMod_MessageBox_Entities
data.value: There was an error trying to fetch your entities.

data.name: QuickActions_CheckHassManager_MessageBox1
data.value: Unable to fetch your entities because of missing config, please enter the required values in the config screen.

data.name: QuickActions_LblLoading
data.value: please wait while your entities are fetched ...

data.name: QuickActions_MessageBox_EntityFailed
data.value: There was an error trying to fetch your entities.

data.name: Restart_LblInfo1
data.value: Please wait a bit while HASS.Agent restarts ..

data.name: Restart_LblTask1
data.value: Waiting for previous instance to close

data.name: Restart_ProcessRestart_MessageBox1
data.value:
HASS.Agent is still active after {0} seconds. Please close all instances and restart manually.
Check the logs for more info, and optionally inform the developers.

data.name: SensorsConfig_BtnStore_MessageBox1
data.value: An error occured while saving the sensors, check the logs for more info.

data.name: SensorsManager_ActiveWindowSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the title of the current active window.

data.name: SensorsManager_AudioSensorsDescription
data.value:
Provides information various aspects of your device's audio:
Current peak volume level (can be used as a simple 'is something playing' value).
Default audiodevice: name, state and volume.
Summary of your audio sessions: application name, muted state, volume and current peak volume.

data.name: SensorsManager_BatterySensorsDescription
data.value: Provides a sensor with the current charging status, estimated amount of minutes on a full charge, remaining charge as a percentage, remaining charge in minutes and the powerline status.

data.name: SensorsManager_CpuLoadSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the current load of the first CPU as a percentage.

data.name: SensorsManager_CurrentClockSpeedSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the current clockspeed of the first CPU.

data.name: SensorsManager_CurrentVolumeSensorDescription
data.value:
Provides the current volume level as a percentage.
Currently takes the volume of your default device.

data.name: SensorsManager_DisplaySensorsDescription
data.value: Provides a sensor with the amount of displays, name of the primary display, and per display its name, resolution and bits per pixel.

data.name: SensorsManager_DummySensorDescription
data.value: Dummy sensor for testing purposes, sends a random integer value between 0 and 100.

data.name: SensorsManager_GpuLoadSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the current load of the first GPU as a percentage.

data.name: SensorsManager_GpuTemperatureSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the current temperature of the first GPU.

data.name: SensorsManager_LastActiveSensorDescription
data.value: Provides a datetime value containing the last moment the user provided any input.

data.name: SensorsManager_LastBootSensorDescription
data.value:
Provides a datetime value containing the last moment the system (re)booted.
Important: Windows' FastBoot option can throw this value off, because that's a form of hibernation. You can disable it through Power Options -> 'Choose what the power buttons do' -> uncheck 'Turn on fast start-up'. It doesn't make much difference for modern machines with SSDs, but disabling makes sure you get a clean state after rebooting.

data.name: SensorsManager_LastSystemStateChangeSensorDescription
data.value:
Provides the last system state change:
ApplicationStarted, Logoff, SystemShutdown, Resume, Suspend, ConsoleConnect, ConsoleDisconnect, RemoteConnect, RemoteDisconnect, SessionLock, SessionLogoff, SessionLogon, SessionRemoteControl and SessionUnlock.

data.name: SensorsManager_LoggedUserSensorDescription
data.value: Returns the name of the currently logged user.

data.name: SensorsManager_LoggedUsersSensorDescription
data.value: Returns a json-formatted list of currently logged users.

data.name: SensorsManager_MemoryUsageSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the amount of used memory as a percentage.

data.name: SensorsManager_MicrophoneActiveSensorDescription
data.value: Provides a bool value based on whether the microphone is currently being used.

data.name: SensorsManager_NamedWindowSensorDescription
data.value: Provides an ON/OFF value based on whether the window is currently open (doesn't have to be active).

data.name: SensorsManager_NetworkSensorsDescription
data.value:
Provides card info, configuration, transfer- & package statistics and addresses (ip, mac, dhcp, dns) of the selected network card(s).
This is a multi-value sensor.

data.name: SensorsManager_PerformanceCounterSensorDescription
data.value:
Provides the values of a performance counter.
For example, the built-in CPU load sensor uses these values:
Category: Processor Counter: % Processor Time Instance: _Total
You can explore the counters through Windows' 'perfmon.exe' tool.

data.name: SensorsManager_ProcessActiveSensorDescription
data.value: Provides the number of active instances of the process.

data.name: SensorsManager_ServiceStateSensorDescription
data.value:
Returns the state of the provided service: NotFound, Stopped, StartPending, StopPending, Running, ContinuePending, PausePending or Paused.
Make sure to provide the 'Service name', not the 'Display name'.

data.name: SensorsManager_SessionStateSensorDescription
data.value:
Provides the current session state:
Locked, Unlocked or Unknown.
Use a LastSystemStateChangeSensor to monitor session state changes.

data.name: SensorsManager_StorageSensorsDescription
data.value: Provides the labels, total size (MB), available space (MB), used space (MB) and file system of all present non-removable disks.

data.name: SensorsManager_UserNotificationStateSensorDescription
data.value:
Provides the current user state:
NotPresent, Busy, RunningDirect3dFullScreen, PresentationMode, AcceptsNotifications, QuietTime or RunningWindowsStoreApp.
Can for instance be used to determine whether to send notifications or TTS messages.

data.name: SensorsManager_WebcamActiveSensorDescription
data.value: Provides a bool value based on whether the webcam is currently being used.

data.name: SensorsManager_WindowsUpdatesSensorsDescription
data.value:
Provides a sensor with the amount of pending driver updates and a sensor with the amount of pending software updates.
This is a costly request, so the recommended interval is 15 minutes (900 seconds). But it's capped at 10 minutes, if you provide a lower value, you'll get the last known list.

data.name: SensorsManager_WmiQuerySensorDescription
data.value: Provides the result of the WMI query.

data.name: SensorsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox10
data.value: Enter the name of a process first.

data.name: SensorsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox11
data.value: Enter the name of a service first.

data.name: SensorsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox4
data.value: There's already a single-value sensor with that name. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: SensorsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox5
data.value: There's already a multi-value sensor with that name. Are you sure you want to continue?

data.name: SensorsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox6
data.value: Enter an interval between 1 and 43200 (12 hours) first.

data.name: SensorsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox9
data.value: Enter a category and instance first.

data.name: ServiceCommands_BtnStore_MessageBox1
data.value: An error occured while saving the commands, check the logs for more info.

data.name: ServiceConnect_CommandsFailedMessage
data.value:
The service returned an error while requesting its configured commands. Check the logs for more info.
You can open the logs and manage the service from the configuration panel.

data.name: ServiceConnect_CommunicationFailed
data.value: communicating with the service has failed

data.name: ServiceConnect_CommunicationFailedMessage
data.value:
Unable to communicate with the service. Check the logs for more info.
You can open the logs and manage the service from the configuration panel.

data.name: ServiceConnect_Connecting
data.value: connecting with the satellite service, one moment please ..

data.name: ServiceConnect_Failed
data.value: connecting to the service has failed

data.name: ServiceConnect_FailedMessage
data.value:
The service hasn't been found! You can install and manage it from the configuration panel.
When it's up and running, come back here to configure the commands and sensors.

data.name: ServiceConnect_LblLoading
data.value: connecting with the satellite service, one moment please ..

data.name: ServiceConnect_MqttFailedMessage
data.value:
The service returned an error while requesting its MQTT settings. Check the logs for more info.
You can open the logs and manage the service from the configuration panel.

data.name: ServiceConnect_SensorsFailedMessage
data.value:
The service returned an error while requesting its configured sensors. Check the logs for more info.
You can open the logs and manage the service from the configuration panel.

data.name: ServiceConnect_SettingsFailedMessage
data.value:
The service returned an error while requesting its settings. Check the logs for more info.
You can open the logs and manage the service from the configuration panel.

data.name: ServiceConnect_UnauthorizedMessage
data.value:
You are not authorized to contact the service.
If you have the correct auth ID, you can set it now and try again.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_BtnStoreCustomExecutor_MessageBox1
data.value: Please select an executor first (tip: doubleclick to browse).

data.name: ServiceGeneral_BtnStoreCustomExecutor_MessageBox2
data.value: The selected executor isn't found. Please select a new one.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_LblAuthIdInfo_MessageBox1
data.value:
Set an auth ID if you don't want every instance of HASS.Agent on this PC to connect with the satellite service.
Only the instances that have the correct ID, can connect.
Leave empty to allow all to connect.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_LblDeviceNameInfo_MessageBox1
data.value:
This is the name with which the satellite service registers itself on Home Assistant.
By default, it's your PC's name plus '-satellite'.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_LblDisconGraceInfo_MessageBox1
data.value: The amount of time the satellite service will wait before reporting a lost connection to the MQTT broker.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_LblInfo1
data.value: This page contains general configuration items. For MQTT settings, sensors and commands, browse the tabs on top.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_SavingFailedMessageBox
data.value: An error occured while saving, check the logs for more info.

data.name: ServiceGeneral_TbAuthId_MessageBox1
data.value:
Storing an empty auth ID will allow all HASS.Agent to access the service.
Are you sure you want this?

data.name: ServiceMqtt_BtnStore_MessageBox1
data.value: An error occured while saving the configuration, check the logs for more info.

data.name: ServiceMqtt_LblInfo1
data.value: Commands and sensors are sent through MQTT. Please provide credentials for your server. If you're using the HA addon, you can probably use the preset address.

data.name: ServiceMqtt_LblTip3
data.value: tip: doubleclick these fields to browse

data.name: ServiceReinstall_LblInfo1
data.value: Please wait while the satellite service is reinstalled ..

data.name: ServiceReinstall_ProcessReinstall_MessageBox1
data.value: Not all steps completed succesfully. Please consult the logs for more information.

data.name: ServiceSensors_BtnStore_MessageBox1
data.value: An error occured while saving the sensors, check the logs for more info.

data.name: ServiceSetState_LblInfo1
data.value: Please wait while the satellite service is configured ..

data.name: ServiceSetState_ProcessState_MessageBox1
data.value:
Something went wrong while processing the desired service state.
Please consult the logs for more information.

data.name: UpdateManager_DownloadAndExecuteUpdate_MessageBox1
data.value:
Unable to prepare downloading the update, check the logs for more info.
The release page will now open instead.

data.name: UpdateManager_DownloadAndExecuteUpdate_MessageBox2
data.value:
Unable to download the update, check the logs for more info.
The release page will now open instead.

data.name: UpdateManager_DownloadAndExecuteUpdate_MessageBox3
data.value:
The downloaded file FAILED the certificate check.
This could be a technical error, but also a tampered file!
Please check the logs, and post a ticket with the findings.

data.name: UpdateManager_DownloadAndExecuteUpdate_MessageBox4
data.value:
Unable to launch the installer (did you approve the UAC prompt?), check the logs for more info.
The release page will now open instead.

data.name: UpdateManager_GetLatestVersionInfo_Error
data.value: error fetching info, check the logs

data.name: UpdatePending_LblUpdateQuestion_Download
data.value: Do you want to &download and launch the installer?

data.name: UpdatePending_LblUpdateQuestion_Navigate
data.value: Do you want to &navigate to the release page?

data.name: UpdatePending_NewBetaRelease
data.value: There's a new BETA release available:

data.name: SensorsMod_TestPerformanceCounter_MessageBox1
data.value: Enter a category and counter first.

data.name: SensorsMod_TestPerformanceCounter_MessageBox3
SensorsMod_TestWmi_MessageBox3
SensorsMod_WmiTestFailed
data.value:
It looks like your scope is malformed. It should probably start like this:
\\.\ROOT\
The scope you entered:
{0}
Tip: make sure you haven't switched the scope and query fields around.
Do you still want to use the current values?

data.name: ServiceGeneral_LblInfo2
data.value: You can use the satellite service to run sensors and commands without having to be logged in. Not all types are available, for instance the 'LaunchUrl' command can only be added as a regular command.

data.name: CommandsManager_WebViewCommandDescription
data.value:
Shows a window with the provided URL.
This differs from the 'LaunchUrl' command in that it doesn't load a full-fledged browser, just the provided URL in its own window.
You can use this to for instance quickly show Home Assistant's dashboard.
By default, it stores cookies indefinitely so you only have to log in once.

data.name: CommandsManager_CommandsManager_SendWindowToFrontCommandDescription
data.value:
Looks for the specified process, and tries to send its main window to the front.
If the application is minimized, it'll get restored.
Example: if you want to send VLC to the foreground, use 'vlc'.

data.name: CommandsMod_BtnStore_MessageBox8
data.value:
If you don't configure the command, you can only use this entity with an 'action' value through Home Assistant and it'll show using the default settings. Running it as-is won't do anything.
Are you sure you want this ?

data.name: Main_CheckDpiScalingFactor_MessageBox1
data.value:
It looks like you're using an alternative scaling. This may result in some parts of HASS.Agent not looking as intended.
Please report any unusable aspects on GitHub. Thanks!
Note: this message only shows once.

data.name: WebViewCommandConfig_SetStoredVariables_MessageBox1
data.value: Unable to load the stored command settings, resetting to default.

data.name: ConfigLocalApi_LblInfo1
data.value: HASS.Agent has its own local API, so Home Assistant can send requests (for instance to send a notification). You can configure it globally here, and afterwards you can configure the dependent sections (currently notifications and mediaplayer).

data.name: ConfigLocalApi_LblInfo2
data.value: To be able to listen to the requests, HASS.Agent needs to have its port reserved and opened in your firewall. You can use this button to have it done for you.

data.name: ConfigMediaPlayer_LblInfo1
data.value: HASS.Agent can act as a media player for Home Assistant, so you'll be able to control any media that's playing and send text-to-speech. The Local API needs to be enabled for this to work.

data.name: ConfigMediaPlayer_LblInfo2
data.value:
If something's not working, make sure you followed these steps:
- Install HASS.Agent-MediaPlayer integration - Restart Home Assistant - Configure a media_player entity - Restart Home Assistant

data.name: ConfigMediaPlayer_LblLocalApiDisabled
data.value: the local API is disabled, but the media player needs it to work

data.name: ConfigNotifications_LblLocalApiDisabled
data.value: the local API is disabled, but the media player needs it to work

data.name: ConfigTrayIcon_LblInfo1
data.value: Control the way the tray icon behaves on a right mousebutton click.

data.name: ConfigTrayIcon_LblInfo2
data.value: this uses some resources, but reduces loading time

data.name: ConfigTrayIcon_LblWebViewUrl
data.value: &url to show (for instance an Home Assistant dashboard)

data.name: HelperFunctions_InputLanguageCheckDiffers_ErrorMsg1
data.value: Your input language '{0}' is known to collide with the default CTRL-ALT-Q hotkey. Please set your own.

data.name: HelperFunctions_InputLanguageCheckDiffers_ErrorMsg2
data.value: Your input language '{0}' is unknown, and might collide with the default CTRL-ALT-Q hotkey. Please check to be sure. If it does, consider opening a ticket on GitHub so it can be added to the list.

data.name: HelperFunctions_ParseMultipleKeys_ErrorMsg2
data.value: brackets missing, start and close all keys with [ ]

data.name: HelperFunctions_ParseMultipleKeys_ErrorMsg3
data.value: error while parsing keys, check the log for more info

data.name: HelperFunctions_ParseMultipleKeys_ErrorMsg4
data.value: the number of '[' brackets don't correspond to the ']' ones ({0} to {1})

data.name: OnboardingIntegrations_LblInfo1
data.value:
To use notifications, you need to install and configure the HASS.Agent-notifier integration in Home Assistant.
This is very easy using HACS, but you can also install manually. Visit the link below for more information.

data.name: OnboardingIntegrations_LblInfo2
data.value:
Make sure you follow these steps:
- Install the HASS.Agent-Notifier and / or HASS.Agent-MediaPlayer integration - Restart Home Assistant -Configure a notifier and / or media_player entity -Restart Home Assistant

data.name: OnboardingIntegrations_LblInfo3
data.value: The same goes for the mediaplayer. This integration allows you to control your device as a media_player entity, see what's playing and send text-to-speech.

data.name: OnboardingLocalApi_CbEnableLocalApi
data.value: yes, &enable the local api on port

data.name: OnboardingLocalApi_LblInfo1
data.value:
HASS.Agent has its own internal API, so Home Assistant can send requests (like notifications or text-to-speech).
Do you want to enable it?

data.name: OnboardingLocalApi_LblInfo2
data.value: You can choose what modules you want to enable. They require HA integrations, but don't worry, the next page will give you more info on how to set them up.

data.name: OnboardingLocalApi_LblTip1
data.value: Note: 5115 is the default port, only change it if you changed it in Home Assistant.

data.name: OnboardingWelcome_Store_MessageBox1
WebViewCommandConfig_LblInfo1
data.value: Drag and resize this window to set the size and location of your webview command.

data.name: WebViewCommandConfig_LblTip1
data.value: tip: press 'esc' to close a webview
